title: First time in 5 years I've been restricted.
body:
Ok yea, I made a mistake. I got mad at a few incompetent people in the game. Nothing unusual, just part of the amazing league experience. However, this is the first time that I've gotten any punishment in my 5 years playing league and two accounts. I admit it wasn't necessary to get mad over a game but, I just don't think it was fair that I got 14 days of suspension.
Heres what I said: 
Game 1
In-Game
Prodigious Mid: oh
Prodigious Mid: i thought it was #remake
Prodigious Mid: lmao
Prodigious Mid: my mind
Prodigious Mid: is blown
Prodigious Mid: by how
Prodigious Mid: you guys obviously dont know how to play your lane
Prodigious Mid: but still didnt dodge
Prodigious Mid: and now
Prodigious Mid: your like
Prodigious Mid: can we ff?
Prodigious Mid: it's called go to norms
Prodigious Mid: and learn to dodge skill shots
Prodigious Mid: wow
Prodigious Mid: my q
Prodigious Mid: i did
Prodigious Mid: ult increease range
Prodigious Mid: and you flasehd
Prodigious Mid: pFT
Prodigious Mid: my ult be on 40% cdr
Prodigious Mid: no homo yah?
Prodigious Mid: LMAO
Prodigious Mid: inbred
Prodigious Mid: i made a mistake ^
Prodigious Mid: holy
Prodigious Mid: why this game so hard :L
Prodigious Mid: i usually win by now
Prodigious Mid: those 2 first
Prodigious Mid: yasuo
Prodigious Mid: if i knockup
Prodigious Mid: you need to ult
Prodigious Mid: aight?
Prodigious Mid: where
Prodigious Mid: is
Prodigious Mid: yasuo
Prodigious Mid: R
Prodigious Mid: ?????
Prodigious Mid: i got
Prodigious Mid: 3 man knockuop
Prodigious Mid: all squishies
Prodigious Mid: YOU NEEDED
Prodigious Mid: TO R
Prodigious Mid: AND WE WIN
Prodigious Mid: LMAO
Prodigious Mid: yas if your as good as you talk you would be plat
Prodigious Mid: but no
Prodigious Mid: im actually plat and smurfing while you're hard stuck silver
Prodigious Mid: LMAO
Prodigious Mid: Da Re with accented e
Prodigious Mid: LMAO
Prodigious Mid: gg
Post-Game
Prodigious Mid: LMAO
Prodigious Mid: the only reason this game went for so long is because you and bot fed like a %%%%%%
Prodigious Mid: and you finnaly got fed enough by picking up kills
Prodigious Mid: %%%%%% is not racist
Prodigious Mid: it's a derogatory word for gay men

To be really honest, I don't think this was even a big deal. I called someone something "Offensive" but in league this happens all the time. I did not call him to action by asking him to quit, I did not tell him the famous 3 letter words of "kys", nor did I threaten him with bodily harm in any way.

If anything I expected something like a 20 game chat restriction giving me a warning saying "Hey, wake the f$@# up, dont say things like that." but no I got slapped in the face with a 14-day ban. 

Some context of why I told the bot-lane they "obviously don't know how to play their lane" was because they explicitly said "I don't know how to play ADC/Supp." and still played. I wasn't saying that out of anywhere, I was just being like. "Let me get this straight, you ______ but you still did it?."

replies.body:
> Prodigious Mid: the only reason this game went for so long is because you and bot fed like a %%%%%%
Prodigious Mid: and you finnaly got fed enough by picking up kills
Prodigious Mid: %%%%%% is not racist

Hate speech is an immediately escalated punishment, so that's why you got the 14-day suspension.

Whatever the case, you used either a colorfully racist N-word or a colorfully homophobic F-word and this punishment is 1000% deserved. Talking to someone like that in a video game is really, really sad.
I did not call them directly the f-word. I used the f-word as a metaphor.

> I did not call them directly the f-word. I used the f-word as a metaphor.

Dude. No. You behaved poorly, you got punished for it, and now you're trying to make it seem not as bad. It was bad. You're not going to gain any sympathy from people when you use hate speech in any way.

As I said, I know I did something bad and I admitted to the fact. The reason I sent this is that I don't think a straight-up ban is fair. More so the duration. I never said I don't want any punishment, I said the severity is too much. I've seen players get chat-restricted for far more, what makes this so much worse?

> [{quoted}](name=Prodigious Mid,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=gEpGhEgX,comment-id=0001000000000000,timestamp=2019-08-12T20:43:18.182+0000)...what makes this so much worse?

The derogatory and homophobic hate speech. Even if *you* don't personally believe that exists, much of society *does*, and that word you used is considered to be especially hateful.

What makes it worse is that the owners of the venue (Riot) have determined that hate speech is worse than any other types of negativity in chat. This is what makes it "fair" whether you agree with it or not. If you don't agree with a company's rules, you have the choice to not support them by consuming their product.

Additionally, it's **hate speech** not by Riot's definition. It's a homophobic slur that you need to retire from your vocabulary before you use it without thinking in real life and end up losing a job, a relationship, a friendship, or some teeth.

Not necessarily, if you only follow something that is deemed "fair" it's nothing more than following something blindly. If I think something is unfair. I bring it up to explain why I think it's unfair and give my opinion on why certain things need to be changed.   That is basically how things change and progress. If I just blindly accepted my fate, then nothing changes in the world. It is up to the people to bring about change. People that are too accepting bring about no difference.

Also, you are right. I am the customer that consumes Riot's product and it is also the consumer's job to update the sellers a problem in their product. 

When you go to McDonald's and find a hair in a burger, do you just accept it and munch on? 
Most likely, No.
You complain and get a new burger or money back. 
You also probably complain in yelp and put a comment talking about the problems in the restaurant so that the owner's attention is peaked.

Dude, this is not a social issue that you need to fight. These are the rules of a private organization.

If I have a party, you're invited, and the rules of my house include "No Green Socks," you can think it's stupid or unfair all you want. No amount of complaining is going to change it. Your choices are to wear socks of a different color or to not come to my party.

That's how you can attempt to influence change - by not going. Want Riot to change their rules? Stop supporting them and don't play. If enough users of hate speech take a stand, I'm sure they'll cave. /s

And I think the rules are stupid and I want to change something about it. That's basically what I am here for. I may not do much about it right now at this moment. But even rocks break in the approachment of time. This is no different, I'm just sending my complaint so certain issues are surfaced. And maybe after some time, things might change.

Also, me suddenly stop playing won't really do much to grab Riot's attention. Much less than writing about in the discussion board so that they can see and maybe do something about it.

> Also, me suddenly stop playing won't really do much to grab Riot's attention.

It will do a lot more than coming here with your attempts to garner sympathy from **people who are vehemently against the use of hate speech and what it stands for**.

You aren't going to get a rally going here, dude.

As the metaphor goes "the straw that broke the camels back."
I'm not here for a rally, I'm here to add to the bucket.
Dude.
That's not a metaphor. It's not even a simile, despite the presence of the word "like". It's a slur.

Again, the purpose of this is not to argue whether what I did is right or wrong. But the fairness of Riot's action. I could have learned with a less severe penalty of 7-days or a 10-30 game chat-restriction.

You can try to talk to Riot support and see if they are willing to lower it for you as a first time offender.  But hate speech's standard penalty is a 14-Day ban. Those lighter punishments are for lighter offenses.
I tried but honestly, I don't even know how to approach this because this is my first-time Lmao.

https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us

Alternatively,  you can search for it in Google.

This is absolutely fair. You may have had 5 years of good behavior, but using homophobic hate speech is not a *minor* violation -- it's a *severe breach of the terms of use*, and earns escalated punishments.

As an avid believer of the first amendment, and following the definition of hate speech- which does not exist. I did not call anything to action. Also, I did not directly call them the derogatory word I used a metaphor. 
As such, I do not believe this is fair because 
A, I had a clean record before this.
B, It is not like I was purposefully using it to hurt someone directly.
C, There was no warning, just a straight-up ban.

> [{quoted}](name=Prodigious Mid,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=gEpGhEgX,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2019-08-12T20:35:53.331+0000)As an avid believer of the first amendment...

As an avid believer in the first amendment, I would expect you to know that it prevents the *government* from unduly censoring your speech, and has no impact on what behavior or speech privately operated companies or individuals allow in their privately owned or operated venues.

You will face no government action from your speech in that chat log. You are not, however, granted freedom from consequence for violating the rules in a privately operated venue.

>I did not call anything to action. Also, I did not directly call them the derogatory word I used a metaphor. 

And the metaphor is rooted in hate: the idea that having a certain sexuality is sufficient to be a synonym for "bad" or "weak" or whatever you're using it as a metaphor for.

> As such, I do not believe this is fair because 
> A, I had a clean record before this.
> B, It is not like I was purposefully using it to hurt someone directly.
> C, There was no warning, just a straight-up ban.

To address these, in order:

* You do not have to believe the punishment is fair for it to be valid and appropriate.
* A clean record doesn't help when you commit a zero-tolerance offense.
* The word itself is hurtful and hateful in any context.
* A straight-up ban is the expected outcome in situations like this.

Consider it a hard-learned lesson on what Riot considers terribly inappropriate.
You have no first amendment rights in someone else's house. If you don't like Riot's rules, your option is to not play. If you choose to break those rules, you'll get punished.
Well, if that punishment happens to be a beating, instead of something fair. I would obviously complain and contact the local officials.

If they tell you "when you come into my house, you agree to be beaten if you do this", then you're agreeing to it.

People are permitted to set rules for their houses, just as any other contract.
doesn't make that fair tho LMAO. So if I agree to be killed, thats fair to kill me eh?

If the same rules are applied to everyone equally, it is fair. Fairness is not a subjective thing. Fairness is objective.

You can say you feel it is an unjust punishment - that the punishment does not fit the crime. However, the crime is considered by most people to be above and beyond normal flaming. Most people would never consider using discriminatory language in League. So no, it is not an unjust punishment.

There are certain words that trigger a ban, you obviously used one of them. 
Also, the first amendment isn't being breached. You have a right to free speech and you exercised it. You do not have a right to go on without a consequence to your actions so you got punished as per the ToS

Technically it is because I'm being restricted in the amount of vocabulary I am allowed to display in fear of a repercussion. The freedom of speech means literally freedom of speech, saying something with no repercussions.

> [{quoted}](name=Prodigious Mid,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=gEpGhEgX,comment-id=0000000000020000,timestamp=2019-08-12T20:45:34.383+0000)The freedom of speech means literally freedom of speech, saying something with no repercussions.

From the ***Constitution:***

>***Congress*** shall make no law respecting an establishment of religion, or prohibiting the free exercise thereof; or abridging the freedom of speech, or of the press; or the right of the people peaceably to assemble, and to petition the Government for a redress of grievances.

Emphasis mine. Freedom of speech as a concept in US law applies to legislation by the government. It has never applied to private institutions.
Honestly, thanks for teaching me something. I'm young and didn't know that fact.
Still, I don't think this was fair, that's why I put it up.

> [{quoted}](name=Prodigious Mid,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=gEpGhEgX,comment-id=0000000000020000000000000001,timestamp=2019-08-12T20:50:25.176+0000)
>
> Still, I don't think this was fair, that's why I put it up.

Ultimately, the punished party in a given situation rarely finds the punishment earned to be "fair." Additionally, the goal of the punishment is not to be perceived as fair to the punished party -- the goal is to make it very clear that a line was crossed that *is not acceptable to cross*.

Yes, however, if you perceive things to be unfair, it should be brought to the notice so changes may occur. I never said that my actions warrant no penalty. I just said that it was too severe, I could have learned the same lesson with a 20 game chat-restriction would have done the same job or even a 10 game. I just think that the penalty was too immediate and severe. There could have been like a 7- day restriction before I got slammed by this whammy.

> [{quoted}](name=Prodigious Mid,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=gEpGhEgX,comment-id=000000000002000000000000000100000000,timestamp=2019-08-12T20:56:26.724+0000)Yes, however, if you perceive things to be unfair, it should be brought to the notice so changes may occur.

This has been brought to Riot's attention numerous times by a number of punished individuals. Riot's stance appears to be that hate-filled language has no place on their platform, and deserves no sympathy or lessening of the punishment. The casual use of derogatory language is something they take a very strong stance against.

Which is why I bring up my discussion so I'm part of those people that are giving this subject to riot's attention. If there is no problem, why are there, as you stated, "numberous times by a number of punished individuals." 
It's like the feather that broke the camel's back. I may be a drop in a bucket, but it adds up and may do something in the future. 
And also the reason why many more will continue to say this instant, severe penalty is unfair, after I say mine.
There's no problem because the number of people who think hate speech should be punished vastly outweigh the number of punished people complaining about it.

> [{quoted}](name=Prodigious Mid,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=gEpGhEgX,comment-id=000000000002000000000000,timestamp=2019-08-12T20:48:57.490+0000)
>
> Honestly, thanks for teaching me something. I'm young and didn't know that fact.

Yep! Not a problem. Learning from a ban is the best way to approach things. :)

> [{quoted}](name=Prodigious Mid,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=gEpGhEgX,comment-id=0000000000020000,timestamp=2019-08-12T20:45:34.383+0000)
>
> Technically it is because I'm being restricted in the amount of vocabulary I am allowed to display in fear of a repercussion. The freedom of speech means literally freedom of speech, saying something with no repercussions.

Freedom of speech is not freedom of consequences. It is protection from the government. Sorry dude, just like any establishment in America can kick you out for going around calling their customers %%%%%%s, so can Riot. Your first amendment right was not violated. You just misunderstood what that right is protecting you from.

Hey, if you’re an “avid believer of the First Amendment, maybe you should read up a little bit to actually understand what it means. The 1st Amendment protects you from *government* regulation of speech. Not any regulation of speech. It absolutely boggles my mind how many people are absolutely ignorant when it comes to this fact.
You are about 30 mins too late to correct me about this. I already learned thanks to the guy above.

Your opinion of the rules is of zero relevance. When a cop stops you for going 40 in a 25 zone, you can claim "I think the limit should be 45 here" all you want. You're still getting a ticket. If a librarian asks you to keep your voice down while you use the facilities, shouting that libraries should be loud will simply get you escorted out. If you go to a friend's house who insists that you remove your shoes while you're in their home, "that's a stupid rule and I do what I want" will lose you a friend. If you are using someone else's services, facilities, equipment, etc., you abide by their rules or you deal with the consequences. If you think the rules should change, that is a completely different conversation (and I wouldn't give a plugged nickel for your chances at convincing Riot to change their rules to allow behavior like yours).

From [Riot's support knowledgebase](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/360024051193-Understanding-Different-Ban-Types-FAQs):

> We work with the overall community and within our own company guidelines to identify what disruptive behavior is and what the consequences for those behaviors should be. We understand that it can be difficult to know where the line is, which is why we provide chat logs and we have a few tiers in the ban process in order to allow for you to learn and grow.

You weren't punished for misbehaving in one game. You were punished for misbehaving in _one more_ game, in a consistent pattern of negative behavior that breaks the game's rules. Additionally, the reform card doesn't always show all the logs that led to your punishment: it randomly selects up to several logs. You might see three logs, but you also might see as few as one, even for players whose punishment stems not from a small number of egregious infractions but rather from dozens of instances of mild toxicity. The purpose of the reform card is to tell you how to reform, so it shows you an example of the behavior that prompted your punishment and explains that such behavior is inappropriate and should be avoided if you want to maintain an account in good standing.

Usually, one transgression by itself wouldn't be enough to bring such a punishment to an otherwise clean account, but the IFS works on an escalating punishment system. Breaking a minor rule, like engaging the team in useless arguments, has a minor punishment: a chat restriction. Breaking that same rule over and over again, however, doesn't prompt an endless series of chat restrictions. The severity of the punishment ramps up over time, because the goal is to eliminate the punished player's willingness to break the game's rules. If two chat restrictions don't stop the useless arguments, the system will increase the punishment to a 14-day suspension and deliver a very clear message that the continued rule-breaking is becoming a serious issue and any further instances will result in a permaban. Again, the point is to put a stop to this misbehavior. If a player is more interested in repeatedly breaking the rules than in maintaining access to their account, they'll lose access to their account.

Of course, it's possible to break major rules, like cheating, threatening people, or using chat for hate speech, and skip punishment tiers so that a clean account ends up with a 14-day suspension or even a permaban.

From [Riot's support knowledgebase](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/207489286-Instant-Feedback-System-FAQ-):

> **PUNISHMENTS GENERALLY FOLLOW A BASIC ESCALATION PATH:**
> 
> * First Offense: 10 Game Chat Restriction
> * Second Offense: 25 Game Chat Restriction
> * Third Offense: Two Week Suspension
> * Fourth Offense: Permanent Suspension
> 
> However, it is possible to skip to a Two Week or Permanent suspension based on the severity of the behavior in the game. Excessive negative behavior can result in a Two-Week or Permanent suspension at any time without having a chat restriction on the account.

From [Riot's support knowledgebase](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/207489286-Instant-Feedback-System-FAQ-):

> We have a zero-tolerance policy for extreme negative behavior as well as extremely offensive language and remarks made in game towards other players. Since it is a severe disregard for the Summoner’s Code this sort of behavior can result in skipping to a Two week or Permanent suspension. Suspensions of this degree based on negative behavior will not likely be reduced or removed.
Well, whatever I got banned. Does this mean that I skipped the first and second offense and hit 3rd? So next time I make an offense of any kind I get perma-banned?

> [{quoted}](name=Prodigious Mid,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=gEpGhEgX,comment-id=00020000,timestamp=2019-08-12T23:05:00.093+0000)
>
> Well, whatever I got banned. Does this mean that I skipped the first and second offense and hit 3rd? So next time I make an offense of any kind I get perma-banned?

Yes, exactly.
